text: I kept waiting for the right twist, but apparently it got lost on the way to the right Paris. Halfway through I started predicting lines out loud just to feel included. By the end, I wasn’t watching a romcom but I was watching déjà vu with subtitles.

This was actually a pretty entertaining film both lead actors had chemistry Miranda Cosgrove getting to shine away from her Disney days. While Pierson Fode also looks like he could be the next Gosling or Chris Hemsworth.
The premise is basically one  of those dating reality shows where girls go through hoops to impress the guy or vice versa and they get whittled down to the one.
Now Cosgrove's character thinks this show is taking place Paris, France so she applies to the show as a means to get there but the producers trick all the contestants as the show will take place in Paris, Texas - USA.
The catch is that the two leads met briefly outside the show and flirted and they actually do like each other despite Cosgrove's insistence she doesn't like Fode. 
So will they end up happily ever after? Will she get to France. Well what do you think?
It's a solid film entertaining andis actually one of Netflix's better romantic comedies.
If you're after a feel good film, this could be it.

The wrong Paris was a good movie. I typically don’t gravitate towards romcom or romance movies, but this was a good movie. I enjoyed the plot in the parody to dating shows. It was great to see Miranda on the screen again I would recommend this film for a wa
Just cringey enough lmao, you know it's supposed to be so it's okay. Funny lines and good looking people, the main girl is kind of a badass which gives 1.5 more stars.
It’s not bad. It follows a typical formula. No real surprises, but it is a fun watch and the leads do have pretty good chemistry together.
It is the stupidest movie I have ever seen.

So much silly fun…..how can you not like a movie with a good cast and a great love story? The grandma from Titanic is a great star……I hope they do a sequel. Sometimes these silly films are better than the movies that promise greatness and are just pretentious and boring filmmaking.

This movie was pure fun. For anyone who’s ever watched a corny dating show, the parody is rich and the caricatures are spot on. The romantic leads have great chemistry. It was way better than I expected it to be.
It’s cute. And the leads have good chemistry.
What could have been a decent premise turned into a B level Hallmark movie.
A very cute and fun romantic comedy.

A fun and silly rom-com that I enjoyed WAY MORE than I thought I would. The actors were incredibly likable and I laughed out loud numerous times. I’m 59 and watched it with my friend I’ve know since jr high. Her husband swiftly left after the first half hour, but I left at the end with a big smile on my face.

I thought this was a really cute movie. It's based off of The Bachelor, but still! It's about a small town country girl who wants to explore more of the world and also get more into her passion: art. She gets accepted into art school in Paris, France but she doesn't have the money to go. So her sister convinces her to go on a reality dating show because there is money to win there. So she goes for the money and also because the dating show is supposed to be in Paris, France so she can get to France and stay there. However, they fly her out to Paris, Texas instead which is near where she lives. The bachelor is a guy who she met briefly at a bar and they connected but didn't exchange contact info. The two end up falling in love, and she tries to tell him about her art school plans but she gets interrupted by the show members. Then another girl shows the bachelor the art school acceptance letter. The girl gets kicked off the show but she does get enough money to go to France. A producer tells her that she can crash the finale if she wants to explain herself to the bachelor but that she would have to forfeit her winnings, even though she really needs the money. She crashes the finale but the guy doesn't seem phased. She says that she thought they could figure out their future together. She says bye to him after he rejects her but leaves a piece of her artwork. He then learns that she forfeited her winnings and ask the producers to give it back because she needs it for school. He runs after her, decides to let her win the quarter million dollars and they agree that they would share it. They also agree to figure out their future together, as school is only 2 years and he could stay in Paris, France with her or fly back and forth to visit her. 

So cute!
I absolutely loved it. It had just the perfect amount of humor, wit, warmth, and love! I have watched it 3 times already and love it even more every time! Just an amazing and feel good movie!

I had high hopes for this movie’s premise, but the moment they landed in the wrong Paris, everything turned into a cheap comedy mess. Every actor looked like they were in a different movie zero chemistry. The romance plot is so cliché you can predict the ending from the first glance they share. Don’t watch this if you’re hoping for something refreshing or thought-provoking. This one’s a horror show.

This movie has its good moments and bad moments.  Durign the good moments the story is great and is quite funny making me laugh quite a bit.  this was dampened by several bad moments also that uust didnt make sense and were total cringe making me wonder what the writers were thinking to include such an aweful scene.  Still if you can get past the bad moments the good moments are worth the watch.  With more good than bad this movie is worth watching.

The Wrong Paris, in my opinion is a movie worthy of 2 stars. The beginning and the ending of this movie are the best parts of this movie. Other than that, every scene is either stupid, corny, or absurd. Of course, there are certain scenes in the movie that are fine and make sense, but other than those, the rest of the scenes could make someone gag. If you like Miss Congeniality and Mean Girls, this movie is for you, but if you like movies with concentrated storylines, I wouldn’t recommend this for you.
Doesn't pretend to be more than anything it should be. A rom-com the works, in an era that is not to kind to that genre. Happy to see Miranda Crossgrove in a lead role.

It’s a film that, for all its faults, does have an interesting modern premise: what if we made a film about a terrible reality dating television show? Unfortunately that was the only interesting thing going for it. 

Miranda Cosgrove somehow finds herself in this self indulgent rom com adjacent mess of a film with AI scripted one liners and cliche plot point after cliche plot point. The film does, to its credit, make me smile an embarrassing smile for how horribly and accurately written its cast of fame seeking, self aggrandizing influencers — only knowing this from unfortunately indulging in many brain rotting Netflix produced realty shows myself. The plot however, is so groan inducing and copy and paste than any I have seen in a while. The two main love interests are initially uninterested, become more interested over a series of time, coincidentally find they have more in common and choose each other over whatever item/job/money was threatening to keep them apart. It’s a formula that can work but this film doesn’t do anything to impart anything special to that formula outside of the setting which doesn’t do enough to differentiate. Forgoing the more engaging and believable ups and downs of a romance in favor of a fast incline and a quickly solved 3rd act conflict. 

Overall I think this was just a lazy boring attempt to continue this trend of lazy modernized rom coms with no heart or interesting story to tell. Conversely telling the most cookie cutter story inclusive of real life influencers, I’m looking at you Harry, a ‘unique’ hook and a big enough name to package it all together. You’re better off watching sleepless in Seattle for the 105th time, folks.

The characters were Likable, the actors were pretty good, though not a lot of depth for Trey. All the objectifying of the women and Trey was just over the top. I was watching it with my 14 yr old son cuz it seemed funny at first but a few inappropriate scenes (shirtless Trey and sexy bull dance were just too mcih) forced me to turn it off.
